Hey guys!

Just logged in just to help everyone out!

Here's what you do to bypass the launcher issue when everything is installed correctly and the steps are followed.

1. Start the game – the Ubisoft autopatch will update it automatically, and you should let it do it
2. The Ubisoft Game Launcher screen comes up.
3. Click on Settings. Check Force Offline. Exit the window.
4. Go to your crack folder, open the orbit folder: copy & paste the contents of the orbit folder to the Ubisoft Game Launcher folder in:
(C:Program Files (x86)UbisoftUbisoft Game Launcher) for x64 based systems
(C:Program FilesUbisoftUbisoft Game Launcher) for X86 Based Systems
*You may want to disable your anti-virus on this step just in case*
5. Open Futuresoldier.exe. Notice that the username SKiDROW is already there. Leave it.
6. Make a password 6-8 characters long. Check Remember Me
*Make sure the Force Offline mode is checked – Hit Apply*
7. Click Log in.
8. You will get a screen saying: “The Uplay Launcher is in offline mode. You can play the game, but other Uplay features are not available offline”. Ignore. Hit PLAY!

This is a virus.  I do not know how no one else has had problems.  It did not install like a normal ISO/DVD (would not auto load) I opened the DVD from power ISO and tried to install from the install file and then it came up with a error message that it could not install because of missing files.  And then I was not able to log access google on chrome do to security issues and bing would take me to spam sites.  I had to reinstall windows for 2 days.  Then like a fool I thought that it was not this file that was the virus and tried it again with the same result.  Fortunately a system restore seems to have fixed the problems.  !!!BEWARE!!!

If your game is crashing "due to badly formed commands", try this: Start > Run > "services.msc" (or enter into the search box on start menu).
Look down the list for "Tablet PC Input Service"

Select it, right click and choose stop.
Or for a more long term fix.
Select it, right click and choose properties.
In the drop down select manual or disabled (based on preference).
Select stop.
It's from Cold_Phoenix in this site http://forums.steampowered.com/forums/showthread.php?t=2733152
Worked for me!
